verses.verse: So it was, when they had come to Samaria, that Elisha said, “LORD, open the eyes of these men, that they may see.” And the LORD opened their eyes, and they saw; and there they were, inside Samaria!
Now when the king of Israel saw them, he said to Elisha, “My (2 Kin. 2:12; 5:13; 8:9) father, shall I kill them? Shall I kill them?”

But he answered, “You shall not kill them. Would you kill those whom you have taken captive with your sword and your bow? ((Rom. 12:20)) Set food and water before them, that they may eat and drink and go to their master.”

Then he prepared a great feast for them; and after they ate and drank, he sent them away and they went to their master. So (2 Kin. 5:2; 6:8, 9) the bands of Syrian raiders came no more into the land of Israel.
(Syria Besieges Samaria in Famine) And it happened after this that (1 Kin. 20:1) Ben-Hadad king of Syria gathered all his army, and went up and besieged Samaria.

And there was a great (2 Kin. 4:38; 8:1) famine in Samaria; and indeed they besieged it until a donkey’s head was sold for eighty shekels of silver, and one-fourth of a kab of dove droppings for five shekels of silver.
Then, as the king of Israel was passing by on the wall, a woman cried out to him, saying, “Help, my lord, O king!”
And he said, “If the LORD does not help you, where can I find help for you? From the threshing floor or from the winepress?”
Then the king said to her, “What is troubling you?” And she answered, “This woman said to me, ‘Give your son, that we may eat him today, and we will eat my son tomorrow.’
So (Lev. 26:27-29; Deut. 28:52-57; Lam. 4:10) we boiled my son, and ate him. And I said to her on the next day, ‘Give your son, that we may eat him’; but she has hidden her son.”

Now it happened, when the king heard the words of the woman, that he (1 Kin. 21:27) tore his clothes; and as he passed by on the wall, the people looked, and there underneath he had sackcloth on his body.
Then he said, (Ruth 1:17; 1 Kin. 19:2) “God do so to me and more also, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat remains on him today!”

But Elisha was sitting in his house, and (Ezek. 8:1; 14:1; 20:1) the elders were sitting with him. And the king sent a man ahead of him, but before the messenger came to him, he said to the elders, (Luke 13:32) “Do you see how this son of (1 Kin. 18:4, 13, 14; 21:10, 13) a murderer has sent someone to take away my head? Look, when the messenger comes, shut the door, and hold him fast at the door. Is not the sound of his master’s feet behind him?”

And while he was still talking with them, there was the messenger, coming down to him; and then the king said, “Surely this calamity is from the LORD; (Job 2:9) why should I wait for the LORD any longer?”

Then Elisha said, “Hear the word of the LORD. Thus says the LORD: (2 Kin. 7:18, 19) ‘Tomorrow about this time a seah of fine flour shall be sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, at the gate of Samaria.’ ”

(2 Kin. 5:18; 7:17, 19, 20) So an officer on whose hand the king leaned answered the man of God and said, “Look, (Gen. 7:11; Mal. 3:10) if the LORD would make windows in heaven, could this thing be?” And he said, “In fact, you shall see it with your eyes, but you shall not eat of it.”
(The Syrians Flee) Now there were four leprous men ((Lev. 13:45, 46; Num. 5:2-4; 12:10-14)) at the entrance of the gate; and they said to one another, “Why are we sitting here until we die?

If we say, ‘We will enter the city,’ the famine is in the city, and we shall die there. And if we sit here, we die also. Now therefore, come, let us surrender to the (2 Kin. 6:24) army of the Syrians. If they keep us alive, we shall live; and if they kill us, we shall only die.”
And they rose at twilight to go to the camp of the Syrians; and when they had come to the outskirts of the Syrian camp, to their surprise no one was there.

For the Lord had caused the army of the Syrians (2 Sam. 5:24; 2 Kin. 19:7; Job 15:21) to hear the noise of chariots and the noise of horses—the noise of a great army; so they said to one another, “Look, the king of Israel has hired against us (1 Kin. 10:29) the kings of the Hittites and the kings of the Egyptians to attack us!”
